quote.text: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, That there be some of them that stand here, which shall not taste of death, till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: But I say unto you, That Elias is indeed come, and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed, as it is written of him.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him? And he said, Of a child.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: Jesus said unto him, If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, Thou dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And the spirit cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And he said unto them, This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know it.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: For he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they shall kill him; and after that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way?
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who should be the greatest.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If any man desire to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: But Jesus said, Forbid him not: for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name, that can lightly speak evil of me.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: For he that is not against us is on our part.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because ye belong to Christ, verily I say unto you, he shall not lose his reward.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me, it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and he were cast into the sea.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And if thy hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having two hands to go into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And if thy foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter halt into life, than having two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire that never shall be quenched:
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire:
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.
quote.author: Mark

quote.text: Salt is good: but if the salt have lost his saltness, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace one with another.
quote.author: Mark
